Showers early then partly cloudy overnight PERIOD Low around 50F PERIOD Winds S at  to  mph PERIOD Chance of rain  PERIOD

Updated November     pm



One man was arrested and another was taken to the hospital after a fight broke out in front of the University Presbyterian Church on Northeast forty-seventh Street and fifteenth Avenue Northeast last night staining the sidewalk with drops of blood PERIOD

Witnesses said a 24yearold Caucasian man was intoxicated and shouting derogatory racial terms when he attacked a black man outside the churchs dropin center PERIOD

The event escalated when the black man began kicking the Caucasian man while he was on the ground Rich Pruitt of the Seattle Police Department said PERIOD

The Caucasian man was transported to the hospital with cuts on his face and possibly a broken tooth Pruitt said PERIOD

The other man was arrested at  p.m PERIOD for misdemeanor assault PERIOD The two men knew each other and were reportedly regulars at the center PERIOD

Mutual aggression is not punishable by law but police are required to take action when one assailant continues attacking after his opponent is down Pruitt said PERIOD
